Title: Deep Neuroevolution: Genetic Algorithms are a Competetive Alternative for Training Deep Neural Networks for Reinforcement Learning
TL;DR: They use a SGA to optimize weights of DNN on Atari DRL benchmarks. Other ES, GA algorithms are open to exploration

Title: Improving Exploration in Evolution Strategies for Deep Reinforcement Learning via a Population of Novelty-Seeking Agents
TL;DR: They hyrbidize Novelty Search (NS) algorithms and Quality Diversity (QD) algorithms with ES to improve it's exploration in sparse or deceptive domains

Title: On the Relationship Between the OpenAI Evolution Strategy and Stochastic Gradient Descent
TL;DR: They explore the correlation of ES and SGD on the MNIST dataset to provide an understanding of their previous results in RL. They find that ES outperforms standard SGD, but is unnecessary in cases (most supervised learning) where immediate gradients are available.

Title: Evolving Deep Neural Networks
TL;DR: They present CoDeepNEAT for the coevolution of topology, components, and hyperparameters of architectures for CIFAR-10

Title: Genetic CNN
TL;DR: They evolve just the architecture of CNN on MNIST and CIFAR-10. They show interesting results, but note drawbacks. Their GA does not explore non-convolutional modules like Maxout nor multi-scale models like inception. They note that evolving the weights (to train) and hyperparameters (to tune) alongside the architectures shows interest as a future research direction. This leads into the future work of a different research group in presenting CoDeepNEAT, which accomplishes this end

Title: Reinforcement Q-learning for optimal tracking control of linear discrete-time systems with unknown dynamics
TL;DR: They propose an innovation to Q-learning based on the algebraic Riccati equation.

Title: Reinforcement Learning with Unsupervised Auxilary Tasks
TL;DR: They introduce an agent that shreads human performance on Atari and does well on another task Labrynth. The CNN model of the Q learning algorithm features LSTM forget gates.

Title: Deep Reinforcement Learning with Double Q-Learning
TL;DR: They introduce the Double DQN that helps prevent overestimation on the Atari domain to achieve new state-of-the-art performance

Title: An Actor-Critic Algorithm for Sequence Prediction
TL;DR: They use the actor-critic method from RL to define a novel training method for RNN on machine translation tasks

Title: Actor-Critic-Based Optimal Tracking for Partially Unkown Nonlinear Discrete-Time Systems
